sources.full: Honkrasque: Lost Pages of the Honkonomicon

trait.name: Fowlish Aura
entries: The honkrasque's chaotic behavior affects the mind of all other creatures within 50 feet of it that can see or hear the honkrasque. At the beginning of the honkrasque's turn, all targets within range make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw, suffering one of the following random effects on a failure. Roll a {@dice d6} (if you roll the same effect twice in a row, roll again):

items: Each creature becomes {@condition frightened} of all goose creatures until the beginning of the honkrasque's next turn.
Each creature uses its reaction to make a melee attack with advantage against a random creature within reach.
Each creature uses its reaction to move at its speed in a random direction while shaking its arms like they were wings.

Each creature can express only through honking until the beginning of the honkrasque's next turn (therefore can't cast spells with verbal components or use magic items that require an activation word).

Each creature imprints on the honkrasque and is {@condition charmed} by it until the beginning of the honkrasque's next turn. Additionally, the target feels a sudden protective instinct towards another creature. If the target arrives within 5 feet of its closest creature until the end of the target's next turn, it gains inspiration.

Each creature with a nose starts to sneeze uncontrollably while tickled by imaginary feathers. The target can only move at half speed and subtracts the result of a {@dice d6} to ability checks and attack rolls until the beginning of the honkrasque's next turn.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The honkrasque can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the honkrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The honkrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The honkrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The honkrasque makes four attacks: one with its barbed beak, two with its claws, and one with its tail, It can use its Swallow instead of its barbed beak. Alternatively, the honkrasque can make up to five quill throw attacks, each against a different target.

action.name: Barbed Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target {@h}41 ({@damage 5d12 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}), until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the honkrasque can't beak another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 20 ft, one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Quill Throw
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d12 + 9}) piercing damage. On a critical hit, the target is impaled to a surface within 5 feet of it and the target's speed becomes O until it teleports away or the quill is removed with a {@dc 19} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) or Strength check as an action.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The honkrasque makes one beak attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the barbed beak's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the honkrasque and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the Start of each of the honkrasque's turns.

If the honkrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the honkrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed Creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the honkrasque. If the honkrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Booming Honk {@recharge 5}
entries: The honkrasque roars with a supersonic honk. Everything in a 120-foot cone makes a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw. A target takes 65 ({@damage 10d12}) thunder damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure by 5 or more, a target also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn and is pushed 60 feet away from the honkrasque. Unattended Objects are also pushed away in this way. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The honkrasque makes one claw attack, quill throw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Gliding
entries: The honkrasque jumps up to 60 feet long and 40 feet high.

legendary.name: Hunger of the Goose (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The honkrasque makes one barbed beak attack or uses its Swallow.

monsterFluff.name: Honkrasque
entries: Of all of the horrifying and dreaded children of goosekind, the honkrasque is the most feared, destructive and unpredictable one. Also known as the feathered aponkalypse and the beak of havonk, the honkrasque is able to bring down entire kingdoms that are on its path, motivated only by its insatiable hunger.

Even if slightly less physically threatening than its landborn cousin (the legendary {@creature tarrasque}) the feathered aponkalypse is able to level down entire cities with its supersonic honk, and can throw quills as dangerous as ballista bolts.

Another more subtle (but threatening nonetheless) danger posed by the honkrasque is the effect that its presence has on the minds of the surrounding creatures: the mere sight of the feathered aponkalypse is enough to bend the will of the observer to the most chaotic goosish behaviors such as honking without purpose or physically attacking the closest creature.

entries.name: Firstborn of Goosekind
entries: The honkrasque was the first and favored creation of the Ur-goose, the Primordial of Havonk. As everything that the Ur-goose has ever done, it is half mockery and half a tool for its agenda: a joke on the most powerful creature of the Prime Material, but also a means to bring down any civilization that has become too proud of its advancements or too dangerous for the natural world.
For more information about the {@creature Ur-goose|Honkonomicon} and its other, monstrous children, see the {@loader Honkonomicon|collection/Echidna Design; Honkonomicon.json}.

items.name: On the Cover and Art
entries: An ill-advised knight suddenly changes its mind about fighting the honkrasque.

{@note Disclaimer. Echidna Design and Follow the Fool will not assume any responsibility related to approaching the honkrasoue for anv purpose, including petting it, picking one of its quills or checking if it laid any eggs. The fact that the honkrasque can convince you that you can fly doesn't mean that you actually should. Behave respectfully to any creature that suddenly makes you feel like it belongs to your flock—the feeling will not last, besides how you currently feel about it. so act accordingly If you don't, it will just be more awkward afterwards.}
